docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: ''The Medicare Measures'' (editorial, June 28) proposes a one-way version of political compromise moving forward with the worst, rather than the best, parts of the House and Senate Medicare bills.
docs.abstract: Letter from Tom Miller, Cato Institute, scores Jun 28 editorial as one-way version of political compromise
docs.snippet: To the Editor:    ''The Medicare Measures'' (editorial, June 28) proposes a one-way version of political compromise moving forward with the worst, rather than the best, parts of the House and Senate Medicare bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: People without insurance not only use the emergency room as their doctor, but often as their dentist as well, according to a study released yesterday. The study, published in The Annals of Emergency Medicine, looked at data from broad surveys to estimate that from 1997 to 2000 an average of 738,000 emergency room visits were made each year, primarily for tooth pain or injury. The visits were most common among those 18 to 35: they accounted for 77 percent of dental complaints, but for only 47 percent of all emergency room visits.
docs.abstract: Dr Charlotte Lewis, University of Washington researcher, publishes findings in Annals of Emergency Medicine that estimate from 1997 to 2000 average of 738,000 of emergency room visits were primarily for dental complaints; cites lack of dental insurance as contributing cause for using medical facilities for dental concerns; cartoon (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The Archdiocese of New York will turn over control of St. Clare's Hospital and Health Center, in Hell's Kitchen, to the chain anchored by St. Vincent's Hospital in Greenwich Village, continuing the consolidation of Roman Catholic hospitals in New York City. The deal, to be announced today, will take 30 to 60 days to complete, hospital officials said, and St. Clare's will be renamed St. Vincent's Midtown. The move comes three years after the archdiocese relinquished control of St. Vincent's. That hospital then formed a chain, St. Vincent Catholic Medical Centers, with several smaller hospitals run by the Brooklyn diocese.

headline.main: St. Vincent's to Take Control Of Hospital in Hell's Kitchen

docs.abstract: New York Archdiocese to turn over control of St Clare's Hospital in Hell's Kitchen to chain anchored by St Vincent's Hospital in Greenwich Village; action continues consolidation of Roman Catholic hospitals in city (S)
